title: For loop printing values vertical - Python 3.5
body:
Having trouble grabbing each id that I post in this list, for some reason it's grabbing them vertically? Any help would be appreciated.

ids = ['880415003748257793', '880415005073702912','880415004809408512','880415007942619136', '880415008470908930','880415010987560960', '880415011105067009', '880415011709083648']

for e in ids:
    print (e[0])

#Output:
8
8
8
8
8
8
8

I want (e[0]) to be the first id (e.g. 880415003748257793). This may be a simple fix, I just have been stuck on it.
